channel.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
channel.description: Just downloaded the demo off PSN and unlike most other fps games, this one is pretty decent, the attempt at humour ruins it abit but the controls and general gameplay is good, there is basically no learning curve if you have played other games like COD4. The multiplayer is probably on par or slightly better than CoD4's imo and that alone is something that makes me want to go buy the game. So i'll probably buy it in a few months (after i'm done with mgs4 :D).

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
item.dc:creator: @kaza Kaza
item.description:
@kaza wrote:

Great game. Rank 4 already :D.

Looks like a game worth buying…

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
item.dc:creator: @Holic Holic
item.description:
@Holic wrote:

Oh my god. I love this game already. I played the demo for a couple of hours yesterday and I’m hooked.
It’s a bit hard to see some stuff every now and again, due to the lack of a HDTV, but overall it kicks ass.
Controls are simple, gameplay is awesome, graphics are wicked and the destructible environment just makes it all that much better.
Being a demo and blowing holes in shit because you’re too lazy to walk around, or open the door, is awesome.

Read full topic

The killcam, imo was a bad idea in cod4 and putting one in BF:BC would ruin it totally imo. You don’t see who kills you in a real war do you? I know its not a real war but having a kill cam would make lessen the experience imo and would kill it for snipers.
[/quote]Play hardcore. ;)[/quote]
hardcore is for yanks who want to kill their own team

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“goatee, post:16, topic:210521”]The sound design is really good… but sometimes you shoot a barrel far off and you don’t here the explosion… it’s disappointing.

Graphics are standard and the destructible environment is good, but could be much better (shooting a roof with artillery doesn’t destroy the roof?)

The knife needs to not stay out once you draw it, it should be just a slash like CoD4. And there should be some kind of killcam/replay or maybe just have the camera look at the person who killed you. Vehicles are good, but the controls are wierd, Left trigger and LB/A and X is just gay.

I’m going to get the game… but it’s not better than CoD4, only in the sense it feels like a war and not a battle.[/quote]
thats coz you have the devil 360 also as Thug said killcam would be shit why would you wanna watch yourself get shot, perhaps after the game a reply feature would be good so you could watch it like a film it would win the machinima people then and it would be pretty sexy you could make a war film on BF:BC lol that would be epic

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

The killcam, imo was a bad idea in cod4 and putting one in BF:BC would ruin it totally imo. You don’t see who kills you in a real war do you? I know its not a real war but having a kill cam would make lessen the experience imo and would kill it for snipers.

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

The sound design is really good… but sometimes you shoot a barrel far off and you don’t here the explosion… it’s disappointing.

Graphics are standard and the destructible environment is good, but could be much better (shooting a roof with artillery doesn’t destroy the roof?)

The knife needs to not stay out once you draw it, it should be just a slash like CoD4. And there should be some kind of killcam/replay or maybe just have the camera look at the person who killed you. Vehicles are good, but the controls are wierd, Left trigger and LB/A and X is just gay.

I’m going to get the game… but it’s not better than CoD4, only in the sense it feels like a war and not a battle.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Something about this game makes me want to play it, it seems more like a war than any other game, a proper war. Like when you are far back in the battlefield you can see and hear all the gunfire and explosions.

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

I have played this game more and some things attract my attention, the time it takes to switch from the run animation into a firing stance is too long, if you run into an enemy they can gun you down before you can redraw your weapon. Also swimming backwards is faster than swimming forwards in the game. Another thing is the engines capability, it does its job fine but not overly well, the destruction of the walla is sketchy to say the least, if you shoot at the wall there are predetermined shapes in the wall that break so you could hit the side of this shape and the wall next to the bit you fired at will explode. Compared to the Euphoria engine in the latest starwars game to which is arriving next year i beleive it doesn’t stack up, they have completely free destruction of objects such as wood which splinter where you hit, i personally saw this at a demo where the developers where throwing R2D2’s at the wood and watching it boe and bend depending on where the robot hit the wood. If thrown with more force the robot caused the wood to snap and break off.Finally their shitty excuse for you not to leave the map pisses me off ‘you’re in artillery range’ when they hit you with artillery anyway i’m like wtf

Read full topic

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo

item.title: Battlefield: Bad company - Demo
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

Thug-life:

The Fully destructible (sp) enviroment works very well in a game like this.

no thats bot strictly true is it? if you sit blowing up a house it still leaves a frame and you cant blast holes in the ground also lag problems only seem to exist on the 360 on PS3 the ingame graphics are more polished and it plays better on the whole. I have small niggly issues with this game that don’t even merit to be mentioned overall it is a good demo can’t wait for the full game
